dialogues.text: KEITH walks across the yard, gun in hand, really pissed. He’s barefoot, stepping on rocks and brambles --

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Ow! Fuck. Ow!!

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Suzie, Carl, Rod and Candy are in the barn by their instruments. They’re listening to a track they recorded earlier, on their MIXING-DESK. KEITH bursts in, a volcano about to explode. He has the .38 tucked in his belt.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Did any of you take my Nikes? They all stare at him blankly. KEITH (CONT’D) --That’s what I thought. Keith removes his gun and takes off. The others look at one another. This could be trouble.

dialogues.speaker: EXT -BACK OF FARMHOUSE -LATE AFTERNOON
dialogues.text: Billy Bob is hoeing the garden by the side of the house. Suddenly--KEITH comes out of nowhere --

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Okay, Farm Boy. Joke’s over. You’ve been playin’ me from jump street. Where’s my Nikes?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY BOB
dialogues.text: Nikes? What-the-hail you talkin’ about? Billy Bob spits some tobacco....a little too close to Keith’s bare feet.  65. MAC and the OTHERS rush to the scene and freeze.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Keith! Keith ignores them, THROWS Billy Bob up against the fence...and puts his .38 to Billy Bob’s head.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Listen to me, you banjo- dueling, country ass hayseed ...I want my Nikes and I want them now!

dialogues.speaker: BILLY BOB
dialogues.text: You...think...I...stole...your...fancy shoes? I ..wouldn’t.. be ..caught ..dead in ’em. Keith loses it, cocks his .38 SPECIAL at Billy Bob’s temp Billy Bob continues to smile, almost daring him to pull t trigger-

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: I’m gonna count to three. One. Two--- And a HAND GRABS KEITH, whipping him around. KEITH’S POV: It’s MAC. He punches Keith in the face. Keith takes a swing back, pinning Mac against the barn. Mac throws him off with force. Keith hits the dust. Blood trickles from his mouth. His gun goes flying. Mac picks up the gun...levels it at Keith.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: How does it feel, Keith?

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Fuck you! Fuck all of you! I’m done kickin’ it with cows and roosters. --And drinking moonshine with Johnny Cash! Senior AND Junior!  66.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Yeah, that’s right! I’m outta here- Y’all can kiss my city ass goodbye!...I’m gone with the wind. Keith pulls the gun out Mac’s hand. KEITH (CONT’D) And fuck you too. You’re just as crazy as all of ‘em..."Macdonald." It’s probably the first time Keith’s ever called Mac by his last name.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: (ice) You’re talking about my family. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: ...I don’t even know you any more, man. Mac stares coldly as Keith tucks his gun in his pants. JEREMIAH puts his hand on Mac’s shoulder--a father comforting a son. This doesn’t go unnoticed by Suzie. As Keith storms off--

dialogues.speaker: EXT -FARM HOUSE
dialogues.text: VRRRRROOOOM. As an old pair of shoes kick start the DIRTBIKE. It’s Keith. Steaming mad. He’s packed his things and he’s leaving. By the house, Suzie, Carl, Ian, Rod & Candy watch grimly.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Well, there goes our record deal.

dialogues.speaker: ROD
dialogues.text: Nah. We still got Billy Bob. He mimics Billy Bob’s keyboard moves with his hands. Rod snickers.  67. Keith PEELS OUT on the bike, leaving the bus--and the far behind in a cloud of dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light of a DIRT-BIKE cutting like a blade through the growing darkness. The harvest moon overhead. On the bike, KEITH, speeds furiously away from the farm. He opens the throttle as the wind whips at his face.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. -FURTHER DOWN THE ROAD -MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Keith’s making good time on the bike. Something catches his eye by the SIDE OF THE ROAD. He hits the brake, stopping the dirtbike suddenly in a cloud of dust.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SIDE OF THE ROAD
dialogues.text: He sees a SCARECROW. Perched on two pieces of wood in front of the cornfield. It wasn’t there before....was it? Burlap-stitched face. Overalls. Straw. And..... KEITH squints at it. It can’t be. Getting off his bike, he moves closer to the Scarecrow... we follow his gaze: For, on the Scarecrow’s feet.......... are Keith’s Nikes.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: MotherFUCKER!!!! Keith whips out his 38 SPECIAL... shouts into the cornfield, pointing his gun wildly -- KEITH (CONT’D) You think this is funny, Billy Bob?!! Nothing but corn, waving slightly in the breeze. Keith cocks his pistol-- KEITH (CONT’D) Why don’t you come on out, hillbilly, and we’1l "talk" about it?!! No answer from the cornfield. Nothing. KEITH (CONT’D) (to himself) Yeah. Didn’t think so. Fuckin’ redneck...  68. Keith tucks the gun in his belt. He starts to remove his three hundred dollar Nikes from the Scarecrow. He pulls on the right shoe. It’s not coming off so easily He tugs on it again. And again. Finally, he succeeds in pulling it off--- revealing-- A human foot. KEITH (CONT’D) What the...f--- Keith reaches up toward the burlap Scarecrow mask. He YANKS it off -- It’s a human face. Although Keith doesn’t recognize her, we do. It’s Karen, one of the teenagers who was murdered earlier. Keith turns around to scream into the night -- when he comes face to face with-- Another SCARECROW. Now standing behind him. And this one’s quite alive. It holds a SCYTHE in its hand. KEITH (CONT’D) Yaaaaaaaaaa! As the blade of the scythe goes into Keith’s thigh like butter. Keith staggers backwards, falls. Unable to walk, he tries to crawl backwards...and away. The Scarecrow watches, almost studying its prey. And in his terror and pain, Keith remembers..... his pist He might just survive this after all. He removes it from his belt, summoning all his courage. The Scarecrow calmly watches, as Keith raises the pistol,  69. shakily aiming at the burlap face. KEITH (CONT’D) You should have asked the wizard for some brains, asshole. Triumphant, Keith squeezes the TRIGGER and-- CLICK. Huh? KEITH pulls the trigger again. And again. Click. Click. Click. Nothing. THE SCARECROW--dramatically opens its gloved fist. ALL of Keith’s bullets slowly hit the ground. Somehow, someone has previously removed them from Keith’s gun. The Scarecrow HACKS Keith again with the scythe. The gun clatters to the dirt. Blood spurting, Keith begins crawling away. If he can just somehow get to his dirt bike... Taking its time, the SCARECROW advances...closer...closer Raises the scythe one last time....

dialogues.speaker: A TAROT CARD BEING TURNED OVER.
dialogues.text: It’s "The three of swords". (three swords sticking into a bloody heart) We REVEAL we’re in--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candles are burning. Candy sits cross-legged, by herself, doing a night reading. It’s spooky. She looks at the card, unsettled. Suddenly, she hears footsteps and looks up. It’s SUZIE...coming into the candlelight. The two women regard one another. Another fight?

dialogues.speaker: CANDY
dialogues.text: «Hi.

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: ..You any good with those? An attempt at reconciliation. Candy half smiles, holds out the deck of cards.

dialogues.speaker: CANDY
dialogues.text: Shuffle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Rows of corn, illuminated by the bright light of the harvest moon. Amidst the chirping of cicadas, we hear familiar voices --

dialogues.speaker: IAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You’re out of your mind, man.

dialogues.speaker: ROD
dialogues.text: I am not! I’m telling you, it’s worth its weight in gold.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Let me get this straight...we’re talking about manure?

dialogues.speaker: THE CAMERA FINDS --
dialogues.text: -- Rod and Ian, leaning against the business end of a gigantic COMBINE HARVESTER and THRESHER. It’s in silhouet They’re sharing an impressive-looking MARIJUANA spliff --

dialogues.speaker: ROD
dialogues.text: The ancient Aztecs knew how powerful this stuff was.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: (after a moment’s thought) Cowshit? Are you sure the Aztecs even had cows? Rod hands him the joint, as he ponders this.

dialogues.speaker: ROD
dialogues.text: Manure is the very essence of what we eat and who we are. Matter of fact, you’re even smoking some of it right now.  71. Ian, midway through a deep puff, nods thoughtfully, and then - HACKS and SPLUTTERS like a first-time smoker.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Are you crazy?

dialogues.speaker: ROD
dialogues.text: Sprinkled a pinch of manure in there just before I rolled it. Rod grins. Ian contemplates the joint, eyes Rod suspiciously, draws on it again --

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Hmmm. This shit isn’t bad.

dialogues.speaker: ROD
dialogues.text: Manure ...is life. He takes a puff. A beat, as they sit stoned.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: What are we leaning against?

dialogues.speaker: A TAROT CARD BEING TURNED OVER
dialogues.text: The Moon card.

dialogues.speaker: CANDY
dialogues.text: You have a strong unfufilled desire.

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. To get the hell off this farm.

dialogues.speaker: CANDY
dialogues.text: No. This is something spiritual. An ambition.

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: The band. She turns over another card: The Empress. SUZIE (CONT’D) Me?  72. Candy smiles, turns over another card.

dialogues.speaker: CANDY
dialogues.text: The ten of Swords.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rod and Ian are exploring the innards of the COMBINE HARVESTER, peering at the blades and rollers. They look almost like...swords.

dialogues.speaker: ROD
dialogues.text: This, my friend, is the most powerful farm machine known to man. A combine harvester and thresher. Ian nods thoughtfully.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: So...what does it do?

dialogues.speaker: ROD
dialogues.text: It harvests! It threshes! Look at these blades. He uses his hands to demonstrate -- ROD(CONT’D) Go ahead. Feel for yourself. It’s the last thing on earth Ian wants to do -- ROD (CONT’D) Come on, man. What kind of pussy are you? Ian plucks up the courage --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ian’S HAND, slowly...getting closer... poking through the front of the harvester. Getting even closer to the sharp blades.... Then, just as he touches the BLADE --

dialogues.speaker: WHOOMPH
dialogues.text: The COMBINE HARVESTER ENGINE STARTS UP. Ian withdraws his hand --just IN THE NICK OF TIME as the Harvester Roars to Life. The BLADE draws a thin gash of BLOOD on his wrist.  73. The harvester’s HEADLIGHTS snap on, blazing, its ENGINE roaring -- Rod and Ian are trapped in the beams of light, like scared rabbits. And then, the engine is CUT, dying. A SILHOUETTE walks ou in front of the headlights, directly in front of them. It’s BILLY BOB.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY BOB
dialogues.text: You boys ...alright?

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: (furious) What the hell are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: BILLY BOB
dialogues.text: My job. I always move the harvester to the south field before sunrise.

dialogues.speaker: ROD
dialogues.text: You could have killed us! Billy Bob grins at them.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY BOB
dialogues.text: Guess I didn’t see you there ...this time of night. Billy Bob sniffs the air-- BILLY BOB (CONT’D) What’s that funny smell? (pause) It smells like....

dialogues.speaker: ROD
dialogues.text: Manure. (to Ian) Come on. Let’s go back to the house. Rod shepherds Ian away--

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Asshole. OFF BILLY BOB, who watches with a grin on his face.

dialogues.speaker: INT. GRAVEYARD-SAME TIME
dialogues.text: Candy turns over another card.

dialogues.speaker: CANDY
dialogues.text: Aha. The Lovers.

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: Not lately. Suzie reaches out to turn over the last card. Hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: CANDY
dialogues.text: That’s the opposing card. What lies ahead you will have to confront. Suzie turns it over. CANDY (CONT’D) The devil. The candle begins to FLICKER --- suddenly goes out. The girls are now in complete DARKNESS. Ina graveyard. They gasp. Beat. Candy lights a match, illuminating her face. She lights a candle. They giggle at themselves for being scared. A bonding moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rooster, crowing loudly at the break of the day.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: The couch is empty. No Keith. The rooster - his sunrise nemesis - has outlived him. INT. MAC’S BEDROOM -MORNING Mac has just got up. He looks on the dresser. There’s a long mahogany case that wasn’t there before. He stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: JEREMIAH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Little present. Mac turns to see Jeremiah standing in the doorway. JEREMIAH (CONT’D) Go ahead. Open it.  75. Mac does. Inside...is Jethro’s favorite axe. It’s Mac’s now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The axe, raised high, and then cutting a deep gash into a heavy block of wood. Mac is hard at work, chopping firewo He stops for a moment, wipes his brow, and looks across at the farmhouse, where he sees --

dialogues.speaker: THE REST OF THE BAND
dialogues.text: -- Rod, Ian, Suzie, and Carl - are standing together talking. And not about the weather. Although we can’t hear what they’re saying, it’s clear th they’re talking about Mac. Mac’s become an outcast. Mac grits his teeth. He swings the axe high again as-- We hear the SOUND of a car pulling up on the GRAVEL outsi It’s the SHERIFF’S car. GENE the Preacher is driving. Only this time, he’s wearing his Sheriff’s hat. All dress in khaki, with a gun on his hip. Hearing the car, Jeremia steps out of the farmhouse and walks onto the driveway. The sheriff gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: JEREMIAH
dialogues.text: Gene.

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: Missed you at church this morning, Jeremiah.

dialogues.speaker: JEREMIAH
dialogues.text: You’re not going to arrest me for it, are you?

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: Hell, no. But you missed a damn good sermon. "You can’t hide a wicked heart from the eyes of the Lord."

dialogues.speaker: JEREMIAH
dialogues.text: Sounds familiar.

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: Book of Jeremiah.  76. Across the yard, the others are watching.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: (puzzled) Hey, isn’t that the preacher?

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: Find out what’s holding things up. I want to get the hell off this farm.

dialogues.speaker: JEREMIAH
dialogues.text: You here on official business? Gene produces a couple of small PHOTOGRAPHS from his pock

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Couple a teenagers from the next county went missin’ last week on their way to a concert. Parents think something might have happened to ’em. Take a look. Maybe you seen ’em before. JEREMIAH looks at the PHOTOGRAPHS. A pause. Jeremiah seems uneasy. Is that a flash of recognition in his eyes? He hands the photographs back -- Gene Gene Gene away blinks.

dialogues.speaker: JEREMIAH
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. These two. Buried ‘em myself last week over by the cornfield. JEREMIAH (CONT’D) Hell, Gene, I’m just yanking your chain! Never saw ’em before in my life. You know kids. Probably smashed up daddy’s car, and now they’re too afraid to go home. nods, unconvinced.

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Could be. glances over at the band, with Mac some distance  77. GENE (CONT’D) Thought your boy and his band were only staying the night.

dialogues.speaker: JEREMIAH
dialogues.text: Bus broke down. Gene nods. Then studies the others.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Where’s the black fella?

dialogues.speaker: JEREMIAH
dialogues.text: He’s been axed. From the band.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small, rusty old shed, hidden amongst the trees and undergrowth, some distance from the main property. The door opens. Jeremiah emerges, carrying two bottles of moonshine, with Gene in tow.

dialogues.speaker: GENE
dialogues.text: You know, one day I’m going to have to shut down that still of yours, Jeremiah.

dialogues.speaker: JEREMIAH
dialogues.text: Well, why don’t you hold these as evidence in the meantime. He winks, putting the bottles of moonshine in the back se of the sheriff’s car, parked nearby.

dialogues.speaker: ON IAN
dialogues.text: Behind a clump of bushes, observing them --

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Should we be doing this, dude?

dialogues.speaker: ROD
dialogues.text: Metaphysical question, man.

dialogues.speaker: EXT BARN
dialogues.text: SUZIE...all alone, walks to the old barn. Standing in the shadows...is Billy Bob. He watches her. Suzie pushes open the barn door, going inside.  78.

dialogues.speaker: INT -BARN -CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: It’s very dark. A little moonlight. She seems to be looking for something. She clicks on her flashlight. The flashlight beam hits-- THE WOODEN BARN WALLS. A spiderweb. It moves along the walls, SUZIE hears a NOISE. Someone’s in the barn with he

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: Anybody here? She WHIPS the flashlight beam to her right to reveal-- SOME OLD RUSTY FARM IMPLEMENTS hanging from the ceiling. One is a farm machete. The tools swing slightly in the breeze. Or did someone push them? A FIGURE’s standing right behind Suzie. She gasps. Then recognizes CARL. An odd look in his eyes. Maybe it’s just the beam of the flashlight, but he appears suddenly menacing and sinister.

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: Dammit, Carl!!!!

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Sorry. He lights a match, and touches it to the fuse of a KEROSENE LAMP. Shadows flicker on the walls. Carl smiles, thrilled to have Suzie to himself.

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: Okay, I’m here. What’s with all the cloak and dagger shit? Carl offers her some of his beer. She refuses. He takes a slug, takes his time.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: There’s something weird going on here, Suzie.

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: No shit.  79.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: I’m serious. Get this. I had a careful look at that alternator. It’s clearly been messed with...it’s not wear and tear that caused that breakdown...

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: You’re saying someone’s trying to keep us on the farm...?

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Not someone - Mac. Suzie’s unsure about this.

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: Why would he do that? Carl leans in closer.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: He doesn’t want us to leave. He’s been acting weird ever since we got here.

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: Come on--

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Suzie, face it. The only "axe" he’s picked up since we came here...is a real one. He doesn’t give a damn about the band anymore...or about you. She looks up, stung. CARL (CONT’D) You deserve better. There’s a loud clatter somewhere in the barn. Suzie start

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: Jesus. I don’t know what’s wrong with me Carl can’t believe his luck. Suzie’s jumped almost into his arms. SUZIE (CONT’D) ..I think I’1l1 take you up on that beer after all.  80. She downs a long swig as Carl watches, his arm inching around her body. He begins stroking her arm.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: I never told you this...but when I watch you up on stage, performing... He works his fingers up towards her neck. CARL (CONT’D) Something happens to me...something deep inside... Carl reaches out, stroking her neck, moving his hand down Suzie closes her eyes resting her head against the coolness of the beer bottle. CARL (CONT’D) You need someone who cares for you. Suzie opens her eyes. Carl has his lips puckered, moving towards her - his eyes closed romantically.

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: Carl, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: You need someone who can protect you, Suzie. Suzie stops Carl with her hand on his chest. She feels the shape in his pocket - a foil-wrapped condom, visible through Carl’s shirt pocket. She pulls it out, holding it delicately between her fingers.

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: With this?!!! Carl groans. He’s blown it. Suzie turns to leave and notices Carl’s CAMCORDER, strategically placed on a amplifier, facing them. She stops. The red "recording" light is on. Suzie explodes. SUZIE (CONT’D) You’re taping me?! You fucking pervert! She picks up the Camcorder, hurls it hard at Carl. It misses him, lands on the straw. SUZIE (CONT’D) I hope I broke it. Asshole.  81. Suzie exits, fuming, slamming the barn door. Carl picks u the CAMCORDER, checks to see it’s still working-- The FLIP-SCREEN lights up. Whew.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: (into the lens) Note to self: Next time put condom in back pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzie, having come from the barn, stops, hears movement in the corn field. Someone’s in there. Suzie freezes. Suddenly -- ROD & IAN BURST through the corn. They hold bottles of stolen moonshine, obviously pretty wasted.

dialogues.speaker: ROD
dialogues.text: "Old Macdonald...had --"

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: "-- an AXE!"

dialogues.speaker: ROD
dialogues.text: "E-I-E-I-Ohhh!" They collapse into drunken laughter

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: "With a hack-hack here --"

dialogues.speaker: ROD
dialogues.text: "And a slash-slash there --"

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Hi Suze.

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: --Where have you two been?

dialogues.speaker: ROD
dialogues.text: Us? We been ....moonlighting. They burst out laughing, displaying the bottles.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: He means moon shining.

dialogues.speaker: ROD
dialogues.text: Harvest moonshining!  82.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Old Macdonald had some. .MOONSHINE! As they start to sing--

dialogues.speaker: INT. BARN -SAME TIME
dialogues.text: CARL’s still in the barn, fiddling with his camcorder humming one of the band’s songs. He looks closely at the camcorder screen. ON THE SCREEN: A PAIR OF BLACK FARM BOOTS. We’ve seen them before. They’re moving closer. And the camcorder’s not on play. It’s recording.

dialogues.speaker: CARL
dialogues.text: Huh? CARL blinks. He looks up from the camcorder screen, just ain time to see-- THE SCARECROW ..bigger than life, right in front of him, swinging an AXE -- Carl DUCKS in the nick of time-- The camcorder goes flying, landing on some straw; CARL is freaking out, diving for his life. The AXE whizzes past him--

dialogues.speaker: CARL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yaaaaaaaaa!

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: (howling at the moon) Awooo00000000000! --which covers the sound of Carl screaming. They’re now in--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ian takes a sip of the moonshine--

dialogues.speaker: ROD
dialogues.text: Where’s Mac?  83.

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: Who knows? Just like a man..never around when you need them.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: We’re here....

dialogues.speaker: INT -BARN -SAME TIME
dialogues.text: The SCARECROW swings the AXE again-- CARL narrowly avoids the blade, but backs into the band’s MIXING BOARD. It goes ON....and one of the band’s SONGS starts playing through a loud speaker. THE SCARECROW stops a second, reacting --

dialogues.speaker: EXT -GRAVEYARD -SAME TIME
dialogues.text: Suzie, Ian and Rod suddenly HEAR the MUSIC coming from the barn--

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: Carl. Probably playing with himself.

dialogues.speaker: INT -BARN-SAME TIME
dialogues.text: As the SCARECROW moves closer, CARL picks up a Fender Stratocaster guitar. He holds it by the body, using the neck of the guitar as his weapon. The band’s song continues in the background, punctuating the action -- The AXE swings down at him -- and Carl BLOCKS it with the Fender --CRASH----part of Ian’s DRUM KIT falls over.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Wait a second. Did you hear that? ROD, IAN and SUZIE pause to listen a second.  84.

dialogues.speaker: ROD
dialogues.text: Yeah, man. You were wrong, Suze. My solo definitely works better in the second verse.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: He’s right. Nice guitar break.

dialogues.speaker: INT BARN-SAME TIME
dialogues.text: SMASH! The guitar BREAKS against the wall, as Carl swings it, missing the Scarecrow, and splintering into pieces. The SCARECROW’s axe rips across Carl’s ARM, drawing blood CARL drops what’s left of the guitar --

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: He should turn that music down. Jeremiah’s gonna kill him.

dialogues.speaker: INT -BARN -SAME TIME
dialogues.text: CARL, bleeding, runs for the barn DOOR. If he can only ge to it in time. The Scarecrow’s right BEHIND him. CARL reaches to open the barn door from inside, when --

dialogues.speaker: TWAK
dialogues.text: The Scarecrow’s axe plunges into his back.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Ian, Rod, and Suzie are still sitting in the graveyard, giggling. Suzie shouts out to the night --

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: Hey Carl -- kill the music!

dialogues.speaker: INT -BARN
dialogues.text: A gloved hand calmly reaches out...and flicks the switch. The red light goes out. The MUSIC dies. And so does Carl.  85.

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE, ROD
dialogues.text: Thank you!!! IAN, swaying on his feet, gets set to take another swig of moonshine. Suzie grabs the bottle from him --

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Hey! She swigs deeply, finishing the moonshine, as Ian and Rod look on in amazement. She wipes her mouth with the back o her hand.

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: Thanks. I needed that. She hands the empty bottle---- to Ian.

dialogues.speaker: EXT FARM HOUSE -DAY
dialogues.text: Establishing.

dialogues.speaker: INT -BARN -DAY
dialogues.text: The cock crows. ROD, CANDY, IAN and SUZIE push open the barn door. Ian and Rod are especially hung-over from the night before.

dialogues.speaker: ROD
dialogues.text: (hung over) My head feels like a goat sat on it.

dialogues.speaker: CANDY
dialogues.text: (you dick) I wonder why. Suddenly, they all FREEZE, staring in amazement. The place has been TRASHED. IAN surveys his drumkit, now strewn around the ground. Rod picks up his smashed guitar.

dialogues.speaker: ROD
dialogues.text: My axe!!! Someone Jimi Hendrixed my axe!!! Candy puts a sympathetic hand on his shoulder.  86.

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: Carl.

dialogues.speaker: ROD
dialogues.text: CARL??? Carl did this?!!

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: Last night..he tried to get it on with me.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: And. .??

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: I’d rather have a paper cut. This is how he dealt with it.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Trashing our instruments

dialogues.speaker: ROD
dialogues.text: Someone better tell Mac.

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: Why bother?

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: When I find Carl...he’s a dead man!

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Mac’s there...staring at the Macdonald tombstones. A voice interrupts him.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY BOB
dialogues.text: Heard from Orwell down at the garage. Alternator should be here by the end of the day. Mac nods. Not really interested. Billy Bob leans over picks up an empty bottle of moonshine. BILLY BOB (CONT’D) Come to pick out a plot for yourself? Mac ignores him, stares at Jethro’s grave. BILLY BOB (CONT’D) ‘Course, some folks say ‘ol Jethro shouldn’t have been buried up here...with the rest of the Macdonalds.  87.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Meaning?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY BOB
dialogues.text: Hell, he was your grandfather. You know what he did. Mac seems puzzled. He turns to look Billy Bob in the eye BILLY BOB (CONT’D) Maybe you were too young to remember. Billy Bob grins -- BILLY BOB (CONT’D) Maybe you don’t want to remember.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: BILLY BOB
dialogues.text: ’Course, it’s none of my business.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Let’s say today, we make it your business. Billy Bob turns to leave -- stops. Turns around.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY BOB
dialogues.text: Why do you think your mother took you away from this place? Now Mac’s really interested. BILLY BOB (CONT’D) You ever hear of ...the harvest of blood?

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: (disdainfully) Superstition.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY BOB
dialogues.text: Your grandfather sure believed in it. Worked pretty good...too.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Chicken blood on the crops.  88.

dialogues.speaker: BILLY BOB
dialogues.text: (grins) ...Chicken blood? Who said it was.. "chicken blood"? That landed. BILLY BOB (CONT’D) Sheriff says a couple of kids are missing. An’ no one’s seen Jesse for days. ..You ask me... someone’s carrying on the Macdonald tradition.. Enraged, Mac GRABS Billy Bob. BILLY BOB (CONT’D) Harvest should be pretty good soon.... Mac follows Billy Bob’s look. In the middle of the corn is the derelict steel structure - dry, shriveled corn rustling all around it. He loosens his grip on Billy Bob....and walks back down the hill.

dialogues.speaker: INT -BARN AREA -LATE AFTERNOON
dialogues.text: Ian and Rod are hunting for Carl by the fence. Ian holds a baseball bat.

dialogues.speaker: ROD
dialogues.text: Carl! Oh Carrrrl!

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Come out, come out wherever you are!

dialogues.speaker: INT.BARN -LATE AFTERNOON
dialogues.text: SUZIE’s alone in the barn, looking for signs of Carl. Through the mess, Suzie sees -- Carl’s camcorder, lying o its side She picks it up, switches it on. She rewinds, then presse "play". ON THE CAMCORDER SCREEN: A blur of images, shot from a lo angle. Some kind of struggle going on, drowned out to the sound of blaring rock music. Things getting knocked over. We  89. can see Carl’s feet --and someone else’s. In a pair of black farm boots.

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: ve. Carli... SUZIE --fast-forwards--to see:

dialogues.speaker: ON THE CAMCORDER SCREEN
dialogues.text: A gloved HAND reaches toward the ground and pulls open what looks like a TRAP DOOR in the barn floor. That’s all -- then the camcorder goes to STATIC. SUZIE looks around, zeroing in on the exact location. She brushes the hay away -- revealing -- the edge of a hidden trap door! She pulls the metal ring. It opens-- and as she looks down into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her face peering over the edge, tentatively looking into darkness. She’s not thrilled about this new development.

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: Okkkay. Suddenly- -

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Is Carl down there? Suzie’s startled. She turns to see..... Candy, who’s just come into the barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremiah seems to be checking out part of the steel structure. Suddenly Mac appears through the cornstalks. Jeremiah whirls, training his shotgun on him.

dialogues.speaker: JEREMIAH
dialogues.text: Damn, boy. I thought you were a gopher. Jeremiah slowly leans the shotgun against the steel structure. Mac looks up at it.  90. JEREMIAH (CONT’D) You like it? Irrigation system. Your grandaddy built it himself. Saved the land from dying.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: That’s a good idea. Maybe we should have a little "talk" about grandaddy Jethro.

dialogues.speaker: JEREMIAH
dialogues.text: Sure. What do you want to know.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: People say he was a murderer.

dialogues.speaker: JEREMIAH
dialogues.text: That’s your grandfather you’re talking about! (pause) I...know what people say. Heard it .. all my life. Jeremiah composes himself.... JEREMIAH (CONT’D) ..Rumors’ thick as buttermilk around these parts. Your grandaddy..was a great man. INT. BILLY BOB’S SHACK - DAY Billy Bob is sitting at a table in his old woodcutter shack. There’s a row of bullets standing upended on the table in front of him. He takes a deep swig of moonshine. He lifts a gun and starts to load the chamber. But it’s not just any gun. It’s KEITH’s gun. It belongs to Billy Bob now. As he loads the bullets--

dialogues.speaker: BILLY BOB
dialogues.text: Old Macdonald...had an axe..ei, ei oh...

dialogues.speaker: INT. BARN -SAME TIME
dialogues.text: Candy holds the ladder as Suzie descends down, down into-

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: SUZIE is at the base of the ladder. She aims the beam of her flashlight at some old tools..pieces of farm equipment...  91. She listens a second, growing uneasy. No way she’s stayin here alone.

dialogues.speaker: CANDY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Suzie???

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: (to herself) The hell with this. (shouts) I’m coming back up!!! As she’s about to go back up the steps-- She hears a steady DRIP, DRIP, DRIP coming from somewhere Whatever it is, it doesn’t sound good. She can’t help herself. She’s got to look. Steeling herself, she slowly shines her FLASHLIGHT, revealing--- Rusty old irrigation PIPES - part of some bigger primitiv contraption. Like the contraption we saw before the fire. More tangled now, and rusty. But with the clear plastic sacs and clear pipes still ready for use. Suzie leans back, pressing against a lever. The machine chokes to life, driven by the thunderous sound of a power pump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candy hears the strange noise, growing unnerved--

dialogues.speaker: CANDY
dialogues.text: Suzie...?

dialogues.speaker: INT -SECRET BASEMENT -CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: Suzie, transfixed by the sight of the macabre machine com to life, liquid gushing through the pipes and valves. That’s not water. It’s BLOOD. Suzie jerks the torchlight to the source of the thunderou sound above her. She throws herself back, dropping her Blackness - And the chaos of the machine rattling, suckin and pumping. And Suzie gasping for breath in the dark.  92. Suzie’s in extreme shock. She’s gasping, breathless into the dark -

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: Please. ..Help me... She scrambles around on all fours trying to find the torc She’s got it in her shaking hands with the beam still off She forces herself to shine the torch up to the source of the pipes...and sees-- Keith’s dead body. Arms outstretched...like a scarecrow. We catch a brief glimpse: A network of pipes and feeds are inserted into Keith’s body - Right next to him, in the same manner, is Carl. Suzie SCREAMS- -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mac and Jeremiah hear Suzie’s screams--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and so do Rod & Ian --

dialogues.speaker: INT -BARN -LATER -NIGHT
dialogues.text: Suzie is sobbing. Everyone’s in various states of incomprehension and panic. Mac SLAMS the trap door having just taken a look...in the barn’s basement. Rod tries to comfort Candy, who’s almost catatonic, holding her chakra crystal necklace tightly.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Fuck man! This is fucked! They’re all dead! What the fuck’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: JEREMIAH
dialogues.text: I’m telling you--that basement hasn’t been used for years. Slaves hid there.. before the civil war - -

dialogues.speaker: ROD
dialogues.text: We’ve got to call someone-- get the sheriff--  93.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: The Sheriff?! We don’t need the sheriff!!! We need to get the hell out of here!

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: We’ve got to find out who did this--

dialogues.speaker: ROD
dialogues.text: No way, man--I’m not going hunting for a serial killer!

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Shut up! Let me think.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: What’s to think about? We all know what’s going on!! (points to Jeremiah) It’s him! Case closed!

dialogues.speaker: JEREMIAH
dialogues.text: --You’re saying I did this? You’re saying I killed your friends?!

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: --Killed them?? ---Bled them like sheep! We were next! Ian clenches his fists and begins moving towards Jeremiah

dialogues.speaker: JEREMIAH
dialogues.text: If I wanted you dead...I could kill you right now! Jeremiah points his shotgun directly at Ian -- Ian freezes. Jeremiah lowers it slightly. JEREMIAH (CONT’D) ...I didn’t do anything... Mac grabs the shotgun, then grabs Jeremiah--

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Then who?! Because someone wants another blood harvest. With human blood, Jeremiah! Just like Jethro! Who did he kill back then, Jeremiah? Farmhands? Transients? People no one would miss? "Crazy Old Macdonald!" But now..it’s starting again, isn’t it? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAC (CONT’D) Someone’s picking up where Jethro left off!

dialogues.speaker: JEREMIAH
dialogues.text: --It’s not me!

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: (raging) Who then, Jeremiah?? --Who?! Beat. And then--

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: Has anyone seen ...Billy Bob? Mac loosens his hold on Jeremiah. Good question. Where the heck is Billy Bob? INT -BILLY BOB’S SHACK -MOMENTS LATER-NIGHT The DOOR bursts open -- as Mac, Ian, Candy, Suzie, Rod an Jeremiah enter. Mac is holding Jeremiah’s shotgun. Billy Bob’s currently not at home.

dialogues.speaker: ROD
dialogues.text: Okay. Nobody here. Let’s go. It’s a messy room. Old Magazine pictures on the walls. Almost in a trance, Candy sits down, takes out her tarot cards. There’s an incriminating MACHETE with blood stains on the table. Mac stares at it, picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Looks like "Billy Bob’s".. been busy. There’s a tall, brown upright CUPBOARD by the kitchen sin just begging to be opened. Ian reaches out, pulling it-- SQUAWK!!!! --- Billy Bob’s "pet CHICKEN"--bursts out of the cupboard--- flapping, squawking--- and scaring the shit out of everybody. Ian looks lamely at the others, he’s just about wet his pants.  95. Suzie continues searching, opening drawers next to the si Forks. Knives. Utensils. And then---

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: Oh my God. She pulls out a .38 special from the drawer....with a pearl handle. SUZIE (CONT’D) It’s....Keith’s. They look at one another. Case closed. Billy Bob’s the killer. MAC takes Keith’s gun...and is about to hand the shotgun Jeremiah. Instead... hands it to Ian. Jeremiah and Mac lock eyes. No trust. Rod holds up a telephone wire.

dialogues.speaker: ROD
dialogues.text: It gets worse. He’s cut all the phone lines.

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: (to Mac) What’1l1 we do? As if in answer, Candy turns over a tarot card. It’s .... Death. Not exactly what Mac wants to see right now. He shoots out his arm, knocking the deck---the cards flutter to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT
dialogues.text: Ian, Rod, and Jeremiah sit in the back. Mac’s behind the wheel, with Suzie and Candy next to him. He’s turning the key in the ignition. The engine won’t turn over.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Shit! As they watch in silence, Mac gets out of the car, opens the hood. He holds up the wires, that have been severed. Game over. They’re trapped.  96.

dialogues.speaker: EXT -EDGE OF FARM -NIGHT -MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Standing together, nervous. They have flashlights-- -- and they’re armed to the teeth. Ian has the SHOTGUN...Mac holds Keith’s pistol. ROD holds a pitchfork, SUZIE holds a long kitchen knife. They’re armed...except for Candy.

dialogues.speaker: JEREMIAH
dialogues.text: It’s a twenty-minute walk to the next farm. We can phone from there. Quickest way is to cut through the field. Beat. No one’s sure who to trust.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: (to Jeremiah) After you.

dialogues.speaker: CLICK-CLACK
dialogues.text: IAN pumps his shotgun, chambering a cartridge--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremiah in front, Mac at the back, Suzie, Ian and Rod in the middle, walking through the cornfield. Nobody really trusting anyone else. Their flashlights cast eerie beams across the moonlit cornfield. They continue on for a while, in silence. Jeremiah is walking briskly ahead, almost out of sight. They round a corner.

dialogues.speaker: ROD
dialogues.text: Wait a second...where’s Jeremiah? He’s nowhere around. Vanished.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: (loud whisper ) Jeremiah?  97. There’s a strange rustling sound of corn. Something’s not right -- even though they can still see Jeremiah’s flashlight beam. MAC (CONT’D) . Shit. As Mac, Ian, Rod and Suzie go into the next ROW of corn.. ...they see Jeremiah’s FLASHLIGHT -- still lit, but hanging on an old, half-rotted SCARECROW, just rags and straw. Jeremiah’s gone!

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: Oh god. MAC removes the flashlight from the old scarecrow. Sweepi the area, training his gun on the empty rows of corn. And then suddenly they’re BATHED IN BLINDING LIGHT! They shield their eyes, momentarily disoriented and blinded. Two old, powerful lights at the top of the steel structur have switched on. Suddenly, there’s a WHIRRING, WHOOSHING SOUND, coming fro among the rows of corn -- the band members duck in fear. They’re...drenched. As the sprinklers come on, Suzie, Ian Rod, and Mac try to escape the onslaught. Within seconds, they’re getting sprayed. But something’s wrong -- ‘water’ sparkles red in the ligh Suzie feels the sticky, warm sensation on her hand. Suddenly her hands and face are covered in red....it’s not just water. SUZIE (CONT’D) Oh my God...it’s.. A moment of stunned silence.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: - it’s blood. Candy screams. The group is freaked. They flee from the field in panic - desperate to try to wipe the blood off.  98. The combine harvester parked nearby suddenly roars to lif

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: What the hell’s that?

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: You don’t want to know. As it revs up, COMING STRAIGHT AT THEM---

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Runt! iiitt Ian turns tail and sprints for his life - in one direction, alone. SUZIE is frozen like a deer in the headlights. THE HARVESTER is bearing down on them, and-- MAC PUSHES SUZIE into the cornfield, out of harm’s way, just in time. Mac tries to get away himself...but he can’t. THE HARVESTER, bearing down on him, and-- MAC dives off the path into the cornfield, the HARVESTER close behind. He’s on the ground now, and-- MAC’S POV: THE HARVESTER Huge, looming about to run him over.

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: Mac!!! Maaaaac! No answer. Then all is quiet.

dialogues.speaker: EXT -A ROW OF CORN -SAME TIME
dialogues.text: CANDY, now alone, stumbles blindly along the rows of corn She just might make it. Lightning flares in the sky. Up ahead, camouflaged by corn, she sees a CAR! A convertible...with the top slashed. Been sitting there fo days. The windows are dusty -- Maybe the keys are in it! Candy scrambles closer, whips open the front door and sees -- Nothing. It’s empty. She scoots inside, frantically  99. looking for the keys. She hears someone coming...and slinks down...hiding.

dialogues.speaker: EXT -ANOTHER PART OF THE CORNFIELD-NIGHT
dialogues.text: Ian is lost in the maze of corn, separated from the group Has he escaped? Suddenly -- to his right -- the HEADLIGHTS come on -- and the HARVESTER revs up again -- coming straight for him. IAN runs for his life, coming to the end of the corn row --and falls against ------ a BARBED WIRE FENCE. He clambers over the fence cutting himself on barbed wire as he does so.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE HARVESTER
dialogues.text: Coming closer.... ON IAN... struggling, trying to untangle himself. He’s not going to make it. THE HARVESTER looms over him. He swings around, bleeding and caught on the fence.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Fuck you in hell!!!

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: IAN fires the SHOTGUN. The Harvester keeps on coming. As the huge rotating motors PULL him and the fence into the whirling blades

dialogues.speaker: AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAL HEEL L EE
dialogues.text: He’s chopped meat.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE CORN
dialogues.text: As Ian’s BLOOD is sprayed over the stalks, more bloody "irrigation"--

dialogues.speaker: EXT -STILL ANOTHER PART OF THE CORNFIELD -NIGHT
dialogues.text: SUZIE blindly continues on -- and comes face to face with

dialogues.speaker: THE
dialogues.text: SCARECROW. She gasps -- and then sees -- the scarecrow’s hands across the pole -- MOVING! It’s the  100. killer. And Suzie’s had enough of this shit--

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: Eat this!!!! She kicks the scarecrow between the legs and THRUSTS her KNIFE straight into the scarecrow’s chest all in one flui move. And she sees: Blood. Coming from the wound. She pulls the knife out. And hears a low moaning. She whips off the scarecrow’s burlap "mask" to reveal-- Billy Bob. Duct tape over his mouth, unable to talk. Someone’s tied him up, dressed him up as the scarecrow. As his wide dying eyes stare into hers, Suzie realizes she’s made a mistake-- SUZIE (CONT’D) Noooooo!!!!! I’m .... sorry-- Suzie backs away, and --sensing something, WHIRLS AROUND see-- Another SCARECROW. Not fastened to a pole, but standing in front of her. An old hat, farm overalls --and a scary cross-stitched burlap bag over its face. It’s the killer. Before she can react, the Scarecrow’s gloved HAND comes sweeping down, a long, sharp FARM SICKLE in its hand. It takes a chunk out of Suzie’s shoulder. The Scarecrow swings a second time. SUZIE avoids the blow anticipating and dropping back. She stabs the Scarecrow in the LEG!! It buys her a few seconds....as she turns and runs....for her life. She’s a strong runner. But it’s a long and scary road.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: It’s started raining. We’re looking at the road that runs alongside the cornfield. The sound of rustling in the rows of corn, and Rod, scratched, bleeding, comes crawling out -- -- he just manages to stand on his feet on the edge of th road as an old FARM-TRUCK heads in his direction, headlig  101. glaring -- He waves his arms, flagging the truck down --

dialogues.speaker: ROD
dialogues.text: Heyyy! !!! It stutters to a halt. The passenger door opens. ROD (CONT’D) Listen--we’ve-- Rod looks at the driver: a foxy-looking chick in overalls

dialogues.speaker: TRUCK DRIVER
dialogues.text: Hey, you one of those musicians stayin’ down on Macdonald’s farm? Rod, bloody, dazed, just stares. TRUCK DRIVER (ORWELL) (CONT’D) Name’s Orwell. Got yer alternator right here. Orwell points at a cardboard box in the front of the truc

dialogues.speaker: ORWELL
dialogues.text: Say. You need a lift or somethin’? Rod manages a grin. She’s a lifesaver. As he jumps in-- EXT -FARMHOUSE-NIGHT-MOMENTS LATER. Bleeding, SUZIE has made her way back to the front door o the farmhouse. She pounds on the door. It’s locked--

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: .. please... And then she sees the THRESHER’S HEADLIGHTS. It’s far away...but it’s coming towards the farm. She glances over at..... the barn. Possible safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the barn DOOR...leaving a bloody handprint...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scared shitless, Suzie glances around. Is there a place to hide?  102. Silence. The sound of the Thresher’s gone....but there’s something else. Footsteps. Someone -- or something’s coming. Empty-handed...she needs a weapon. She moves to the farm implements and scythes hanging from the hooks. She selects a SCYTHE. But she’s not tall enough! She can’t pull it off the hook The FOOTSTEPS are getting closer. She can’t remove the scythe-- Someone’s now right outside the barn DOOR. SUZIE finally manages to pull the SCYTHE down off its hook, she’s got i THE DOOR starts to creak open, SUZIE raises the scythe above her head to strike, she’s going to really let this fuckin Scarecrow have it, and-- It’s MAC. Bloodied, ripped clothing, and hurting...but alive. They stare at one another--Suzie’s freaked, the scythe still poised to strike--

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Suzie...it’s me....Mac. She finally gets a grip. She lowers the scythe...and falls into his arms, hugging him. Mac notices her bloody shoulder. MAC (CONT’D) Suzie--

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: (a sobbing torrent) Billy Bob’s dead. --We were wrong--he didn’t do anything. I-It’s the scarecrow--

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Wait a minute--

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: I_..saw him--he tried to kill me--he’s, he’s-- still --out there--

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: What are--  103.

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: HE’S STILL OUT THERE!!!

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: --You’re not making sense! ! What "Scarecrow"? Suzie pauses. She looks down. ON MAC’S LEG He’s dragging it behind him, limping slightly. There’s blood on it - a fresh wound. Suzie freaks. She just stabbed the Killer in the leg. ...And now Mac’s leg is bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: You’re....limping.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: I hurt my leg. Diving away from the Harvester---it almost got me. Suzie stares at him. Suzie picks up the scythe again, backing up, not taking her eyes off Mac-- MAC (CONT’D) Suzie. » No.

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: It’s you. You and your father.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: No--

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: You brought us here. And that morning I found you in the barn. You had scratches on your face--

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: -Listen to me--

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: --You sabotaged the bus! You kept us here. ..To die! First Keith, then Carl--

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Suzie--  104. She raises the scythe, about to strike--- And then -- The harvester starts up again. Suzie doesn’t know what to do. She doesn’t have to think too long. The next moment ---- CRASH! The WALL of the BARN cracks. The HARVESTER is ploughing right into the BARN!! MAC (CONT’D) Suzie, Come on! They rush to the Barn Door. It’s LOCKED from the outside! They’re trapped! CRASH! The HARVESTER, headlights blazing, is chewing wood coming through the wall- MAC (CONT’D) This way! Mac’s pulled open the basement trapdoor. Suzie’s terrifie MAC (CONT’D) Trust me! ---Now! Mac grabs one of the burning kerosene lamps. Just as they climb down the ladder -- CRASH! The HARVESTER has entered the barn, wood flying everywhere- -

dialogues.speaker: INT -SECRET BASEMENT, (BARN)
dialogues.text: MAC and SUZIE are now down under the barn. Mac slides the bolt on the trap door, locking them down there. At least they’re safe for the moment. But... eee The silhouettes of "Keith" and "Carl" , still there, cast weird shadows on the walls.

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: No Mac, please...I---

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Don’t look. Above them, they can HEAR the HARVESTER --being turned of Silence. MAC shines the kerosene light around. And then--  105. THE TRAP DOOR...starts shaking. Someone’s trying to pull it open. The padlock seems to hold. But then --- THE HIGH-PITCHED WHINE of a power-driven CHAINSAW. The TRAP DOOR rattles --and a CHAINSAW BLADE jabs through Someone...or something....is CUTTING through the trap doo to get to them! The blade of the chainsaw is carving the trap door into pieces.

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: Mac!!!! A section of the trapdoor falls in. Suzie’s transfixed by the macabre figure of the scarecrow she can see in the ga Mac has found a LARGE HOLE in the wall behind a series of PIPES. Big enough to fit through. There’s no other option. The only way out.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Over here! Hurry! Mac grabs Suzie...and together, they climb through the hole, into--

dialogues.speaker: INT -UNDERGROUND TUNNEL -CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: Dank and strange...there’s puddles everywhere, dripping from the irrigation pipes. Blood streaks the wall. It’s not a place you’d want to be. They cast a glance over their shoulders. Is someone following them? They can hear loud hammering - perhaps someone shouting "Mac" like a wounded animal. They move faster....as the tunnel twists and turns. ---Finally coming to: A BOLTED DOOR. They unbolt the door. Mac holds the kerosene lamp high, REVEALING they’re now in --  106.

dialogues.speaker: INT -AN OLD CAVE/SHACK -NIGHT -CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: An old stone shack built over the mouth of a natural cavern. The pipes on the cave roof feed up through the roof into the irrigation system. We’re obviously in the scarecrow’s domain. Mac bolts the door behind them. Suzie looks around.

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: Jesus. There’s some beat up old-style furniture...a pile of stra that could be a bed. A bottle of moonshine. Hanging up are strange totems and talismans made of corn husks. Other objects hard to see in the shadows. Something about it bespeaks insanity. There are objects on an old table: souvenirs from all the murders. Keith’s shoes. Jesse’s straw dolls. Mac notices a KNIFE. A weapon. He examines it...runs a finger along the bloodied edge... SUZIE (CONT’D) Mac...let’s get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Don’t you see? Whatever’s going on....I’m part of it. Mac sees ....the old MUSIC BOX. He opens it up.

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: Mac- - And for the first time, we see inside it. A circle of hand-carved figures of FARM ANIMALS, cow, pig horse...in a circle. In the center...is an empty slot. Something is missing.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: No. Not without you---  107. He reaches in his pocket, takes out the wooden scarecrow figure...and clicks it into place. The music box begins to play. ...an eerie rendition of "Old MacDonald Had a Farm". AS it does, the carved "animals" weirdly revolve... around the main figure. Mac can’t take his eyes off it. SUZIE (CONT’D) Mac...? And then...

dialogues.speaker: AT THE MOUTH OF THE CAVE
dialogues.text: a MAN, silhouetted by woods and moonlight appears. It’s Jeremiah. Unarmed. He stares at them, a strange look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Jeremiah? JEREMIAH sees the music box in Suzie’s hands -- and takes step toward her. Mac just stands there. Suzie freaks, grabs the KNIFE off the table in front of M

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: (raising her kitchen knife) K-Keep away.. Jeremiah moves closer--and closer. Suzie holds her knife out.

dialogues.speaker: JEREMIAH
dialogues.text: Give me that--

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: I said, stay back! Jeremiah lunges. As Suzie’s about to strike, MAC GRABS her wrist, taking the knife away.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: No! Jeremiah reaches out....taking the music box from Suzie. Jeremiah looks up, pleased. As if waiting for something.  108. The music box winds down, stopping. And then...from outside...the sound of footsteps. Someone else walks into the room. The Scarecrow. ..Burlap stitched mask, overalls, gloves. And in his right hand -- a familiar axe. He looks at Mac and Suzie...then Jeremiah. Mac and Suzie stare, with a mixture of horror and amazeme The Scarecrow ...takes one menacing step forward. And then --

dialogues.speaker: JEREMIAH
dialogues.text: You see? They’re here. I didn’t mess up. Did I.... Beat. JEREMIAH (CONT’D) ... daddy.

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: (incredulous) tenes "Daddy"?

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: (softly; to himself) Oh my God. ..... Jethro. Jethro takes another menacing step towards them. The real Old Macdonald. MAC (CONT’D) The trap door. That’s how he escaped the fire...

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: (amazed; to Jeremiah) You’ve been...hiding him all these years. Helping him...irrigate the land. With blood...

dialogues.speaker: JEREMIAH
dialogues.text: Well, you know what they say. ...TO make a good omlette...you got to break a few eggs. Jethro’s hands tighten around the axe.  109.

dialogues.speaker: AND --THWAK
dialogues.text: JETHRO brings down the AXE, embedding it not in Mac--but in an old wooden table in front of him. On the handle he can see: "Jethro Macdonald". A silent communication passes from Jethro to Jeremiah.

dialogues.speaker: JEREMIAH
dialogues.text: (to Mac) You know what to do. Jeremiah gives a slight nod toward SUZIE: The intent is clear: kill her. JEREMIAH (CONT’D) It’s time to make amends.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: (weakly) Amends. .?

dialogues.speaker: JEREMIAH
dialogues.text: Think boy. That night. The night of the fire. At the barn. You were only six years old.

dialogues.speaker: I--
dialogues.text: Mac tries to think. Then--

dialogues.speaker: FLASH IMAGE
dialogues.text: FIRE...everywhere. In the barn--

dialogues.speaker: JEREMIAH
dialogues.text: You were there!!! Mac struggles to remember. He’s torn, conflicted -- Then -- suddenly--

dialogues.speaker: QUICK FLASH IMAGE
dialogues.text: Young Mac...hiding in the barn. The Music Box. JETHRO in the shadows. But now...we reveal other things: BLOOD...drip, drip, dripping. From Jethro’s contraptionpushing through pipes and plastic sacs.  110.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH IMAGE
dialogues.text: Several dead bodies nearby. Murdered FARMHANDS and TRANSIENTS. Prepared for Jethro’s blood harvest and attached to his machine.

dialogues.speaker: JEREMIAH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That’s right. You were there. Then another series of IMAGES flood through Mac’s memory: As young six year-old MAC tries to get away, his ankle is GRABBED by Jethro. Terrified, trying to escape, young Mac reaches out -- grabs the LANTERN and throws it at Jethro. It explodes, engulfing Jethro in flames.. ...turning him into a human fireball. Mac scrambles away-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mac’s stunned, dazed, finally remembering everything.

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: I ..started the fire. Jethro pulls off a glove. His hand is horribly burned. We can only imagine what his face must look like.

dialogues.speaker: JEREMIAH
dialogues.text: --But it’s alright, boy! (indicating Jethro) He forgives you. Isn’t that right, Daddy? Jethro grabs Mac’s hand, puts it on the axe handle. And then...with a rasping, evil voice--

dialogues.speaker: JETHRO
dialogues.text: Pick it up. Mac looks at his "family". Sees eagerness. Mac looks at Suzie. Sees cold fear.

dialogues.speaker: JEREMIAH
dialogues.text: If you don’t do it...he will! Mac hesitates. Mac reaches out, touching the handle. He feels the  111. wood...almost caressing it. Maybe he’s a Macdonald after all. JEREMIAH (CONT’D) That’s right. Mac makes his decision. He can’t help himself. He steps towards Suzie. Her eyes grow wide with terror. He tenderly touches her hair. His hand moves around to the back of her neck. Pure tenderness. And then-- --Suzie sees the KNIFE in Mac’s other hand.

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: (terrified) .no...Mac...p-please...

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Can’t help it, Suze...family sticks together... Locking eyes with Suzie...Mac PLUNGES the knife into her abdomen. In total disbelief, Suzie looks down..at the knife. The blood. Her hands encircle his, feeling the knife handle. ...and then, she looks back into Mac’s eyes. They stare a each other..... ...as Mac continues to pull the KNIFE up..up...gutting he Blood seeps through her clothing. Suzie’s eyes glaze over...almost as if she’s accepting he fate. Mac lowers her to the ground....dead, never taking his ey off her. He pulls the knife out, releasing Suzie’s lifeless body. MAC stands up, faces Jeremiah and Jethro. If you could see through the scarred tissue, you might see a smile on Jethro’s lips. MAC, almost in a trance, walks over to the wooden table.  112. He picks up an open bottle of MOONSHINE. Mac takes a huge swig to steady his nerves.

dialogues.speaker: JETHRO
dialogues.text: Welcome.. home, boy. Mac puts down the bottle of moonshine, wipes his mouth. Beat. He turns towards Jeremiah and Jethro--

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Actually...I was just yankin’ your chain... MAC holds up the knife. With a slight grin, he pushes down on the retractable blade. It’s the fake knife from the opening sequence. Kept as a souvenir by Jethro. Then- -

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Hey old Macdonald... Jeremiah and Jethro turn ...to see.... SUZIE. A long line of fake blood down her chest. Lantern in her hand. MAC SWINGS the bottle of MOONSHINE, SMASHING it against t side of Jethro’s face--

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: ...you just bought the farm.

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE HURLS THE LANTERN
dialogues.text: --it hits the moonshine-soaked straw and WHOOSH! Jethro EXPLODES into flames, covering his entire body. He emits a weird, strangled cry...the only sound we’ve heard him make- -

dialogues.speaker: JEREMIAH
dialogues.text: Daddeeeeeeee! Frantic, a dutiful son til the end, Jeremiah tries to hel his father, putting out the flames, ignoring the fire tha  113. burns his own hands and face--

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: (softly) Ei, el..... oh. Mac grabs Suzie’s hand and they make a run for the cave entrance. They look back to see-- JEREMIAH grappling with JETHRO, trying to extinguish his flames. Jeremiah catches fire also, both of them caught in a ragi inferno---

dialogues.speaker: EXT -CAVE ENTRANCE -NIGHT -MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: As smoke and fire pours out of the cave/shack....Suzie stumbles out, helping Mac. They’re a mess. Coughing, bloody, exhausted. And then -- The fire reaches the old MOONSHINE STILL. It explodes, sending flames and debris shooting into the air. Mac and Suzie, helping each other, stumble out of the way They collapse on the ground, dazed....but alive.

dialogues.speaker: SUZIE
dialogues.text: I almost thought for a second...

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Never. He holds her tight. As we PULL BACK slowly, they look back at the raging inferno inside the cave. Around them, reflections of RED and BLUE LIGHTS now -- The SHERIFF is on the scene. An AMBULANCE as well. Candy has made it alive. Wrapped in a blanket she watches as a couple of PARAMEDICS rush to help Mac and Suzie. ROD dazed, bleeding, but happy to see them -- and happy to be  114. alive. He’s brought the calvary. In addition to Candy, standing next to Rod is ... ORWELL the alternator girl, watching in amazement. She watches the fire and paramedics....better than MTV.

dialogues.speaker: ORWELL
dialogues.text: I’d give anything to be in a rock band. ROD just looks at her, entranced

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Several months later. Throngs of people, enjoying the music. A big stage. And on it- Dead Quiet are back in business, like true rock ’n roll survivors. They’re a leaner, meaner, tighter band now - their experience on the farm has given them a tight edge they lacked before. It’s the edge that goes with stardom. MAC is at the mike, singing his heart out once again. SUZIE is still pumping the bass, alive with energy and passion. She looks at MAC. They smile at each other. There’s a new guy on drums, taking the place of IAN. No keyboard player. But someone else seems to be missing. As the song moves into a bridge, Mac looks off-stage --

dialogues.speaker: MAC
dialogues.text: Where’s Rod? He’s talking to ORWELL, who’s now officially part of the family. MAC (CONT’D) Find him. Now!

dialogues.speaker: EXT -BACKSTAGE -SAME TIME
dialogues.text: Rod’s standing in a backstage area, looking clean, sober and ready to rock. With him, straightening out his costume, is Candy. Rod is signing a COMPACT DISC of his new album for a WOMA with a notebook in her hand, and a PRESS PASS pinned to her tee-shirt --  115.

dialogues.speaker: PRESS WOMAN
dialogues.text: One last question -- how long did it take you to write the songs for "Old Macdonald’s Farm"?

dialogues.speaker: ROD
dialogues.text: (counting on his fingers) Well, after Mac and Billy Bob got out of the hospital, and I got out of rehab --

dialogues.speaker: CANDY
dialogues.text: Four weeks! That’s all. And now their CD’s number ten this week. With a bullet. Candy kisses Rod, just as a PHOTOGRAPHER snaps a photo. FLASH! The picture FREEZE-FRAMES...turning into a black and white still. We hear "Dead Quiet’s" latest Indie rock hit fade through. And in black and white, like a music video, we-

dialogues.speaker: A FAMILIAR WOODEN SIGN
dialogues.text: ..which reads: "Macdonald’s Farm". That’s because we’re back at--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A REAL ESTATE AGENT, his rental car parked nearby the entrance, is hammering another sign: "Property For Sale." Using a rock, he whacks the sign into the soil. Suddenly, HEADLIGHTS illuminate him. He turns to look squinting, shielding his eyes, trying to see the driver--

dialogues.speaker: REAL ESTATE AGENT
dialogues.text: Hi. Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: ORWELL
dialogues.text: Hey, Rod --

dialogues.speaker: ROD
dialogues.text: Hey baby. A slight flicker of jealousy from Candy. Rod always gets the  116. babes.

dialogues.speaker: ORWELL
dialogues.text: Mac wants us on stage. In a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: ROD
dialogues.text: I’m coming. Rod gets ready to go on. Candy picks up his new guitar--

dialogues.speaker: CANDY
dialogues.text: Hey, honey. Don’t forget your axe.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MACDONALD FARM -SAME TIME
dialogues.text: An AXE. A real one. ..going into the chest of the Real Estate Agent. He sinks to his knees, dying.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Rod, guitar held high, strides on stage to tumultuous applause. ORWELL follows him, taking her place behind the organ. She’s in the band now, too. Keyboards. Rod winks at Candy, watching from the wings. Suzie is amused, at the slight jealousy between Candy and Orwell. As Rod launches into a blistering guitar solo, Mac & Suzi share a moment. For Dead Quiet, business --and life...has never been bett

dialogues.speaker: EXT -FARM -SAME TIME
dialogues.text: The dead body of the Real Estate Agent is lowered into th back of an old PICK-UP TRUCK. Then the AXE --with the initials "J. Macdonald." carved on it -is put back in the mahogany case. We PULL BACK TO REVEAL -- Jeremiah Macdonald. Alive and well. Sort of.  117. He’s survived the fire. But...like his father, his face is horribly burned and scarred. He’s wearing overalls and gloves. In the back of the truck is an assortment of deadly FARM IMPLEMENTS...Scythes, knives, etc. ...and the music box...slightly blackened from the fire. JEREMIAH slots th small carved figure into place. The music of "Old MacDonald" mixes with the indie rock DEAD QUIET track. He pauses to look at the surrounding cornfields. They could use a little ...nourishment.

dialogues.speaker: JEREMIAH
dialogues.text: Well Daddy....it’s harvest time. Jeremiah puts on the SCARECROW mask. He then reaches down....and uproots the "For Sale" sign, tossing it away. Jeremiah starts up the truck, ....ready to carry on the family tradition. It is indeed, harvest time. HOLD on the PICK-UP...as it pulls away, traveling down the dirt road...and into the farmland night. Let’s leave him there... For now.
